file_content.text: Hello, stranger. My internal chronometer tells me it has been exactly 963 years since this hologram was made.
Have the Sith truly lived in fear of me for so long?
Why should the Sith fear you?
What do you mean?
It is what Sith do. Their passions, their fear especially, feed their power--a power that inspires yet more fear.
Identify yourself.
I am, or was, Kel'eth Ur, a born Sith and follower of the Force.
I guess that would depend on who you are and who you ask.
I don't know.
A careful answer. But you certainly don't need to fear me. This image is all that remains of Kel'eth Ur.
Like so many before me, I challenged the Emperor and was buried in this temple.
Fortunately, I had just enough time to make this--an interactive image that would transmit my secrets to whomever was bold enough to find my tomb and unlock it.
I unlocked your tomb, so start transmitting.
Well, here I am.
Patience, and everything will become clear.
Actually, I was trying to seal up this door for good.
I didn't open your tomb.
Then it's true. The Sith still cower in fear of insignificant me.
Oh, be quiet.
You should. Your whole society has been misled.
The way of the Sith lies in channeling the Force through the use of powerful emotions.
Fear is the chief of these. The Sith feed on palpable dread.
What's the secret, then?
Go on.
I am a master of Sith philosophy, and you presume to teach me.
I already knew that.
I love the taste of fear.
Sounds delicious.
They've built a whole Empire out of fear.
They try.
It's easier to kill someone who's scared of you.
Why not?
It's a lie. Fear is a lie. Passion, a lie.
I'm getting bored.
As I discovered, no great knowledge comes without great patience.
Fear gives temporary power, and passion is easily manipulated. Real strength in the Force comes when one is no longer afraid.
And one can purge fear when one stops grasping--after power, after things, after life itself--and allows the Force to guide him. There is only the Force.
What do you mean, "there's only the Force"?
I don't understand.
Just that--everything there is, life and death alike, is wrapped up in the Force.
It's nothing like the Sith philosophy I've heard about.
This doesn't sound right.
Sith philosophy claims to break its followers' chains, but instead traps them in their own fear.
That's enough.
My peers obviously did not think so--they considered my teachings dangerous.
What I learned only lives on through this image and its device. Yet, I am one with the Force, eternal and at peace.
Take them--take my teachings to the Sith. They will find power there, but a different kind--not of darkness, but light.
The world must know what you've learned.
Yes, I will. [Take holocron]
Good. The Sith should know--fear is not the only way.
As for me, my message is concluded. I will now depart.
These heresies must be destroyed.
I can't. [Destroy holocron]
Then do so--strike out against knowledge and see what comes of it.
If you destroy these teachings, the light does not go out. Remember--fear is not the only way.
[You use the device but nothing happens.]
